abstract.para: &app; is FreeSpeak is a free GNOME frontend to online translator engines (such as Google, Yahoo, etc.).

legalnotice.title: Feedback
legalnotice.para: To report a bug or make a suggestion regarding this application or this manual, please visit the FreeSpeak Bug Tracker.

sect1.title: Introduction
sect1.para: Use &app; to translate text, web pages and getting suggestions when developing localized applications. &app; provides the following features:

listitem.para: Choose your preferred translator engine such as Google, Yahoo, FreeTranslation or Open-Tran
Tabbed consulting - open multiple translations in a single window
Clipboard integration with the translation data
Request suggestions - see how other projects translated a text
Keeps always opened in the system tray to allow immediate translations
Desktop-wide keybinding - select text and press a key to translate

note.para: You can add other translator engines by writing a simple Python module. Some translators don't handle all the available translation modes.

sect2.title: When You Start &app;
sect2.para: When you start &app;, the following window is displayed.

textobject.phrase: Shows &app; main window. Contains menubar, toolbar and translation area. Menubar contains Translation, Edit, and Help menus.

sect2.para: The &app; window contains the following elements:

listitem.para: The menus on the menubar contain all of the commands you need to work with translations in &app;.
The toolbar contains a subset of the commands that you can access from the menubar.

sect1.title: Usage
sect1.para: You can use the &app; application to perform the following tasks:

sect2.title: Translate text
sect2.para:
To translate text, choose
Translation Text or press
Ctrl T .

The Text Translation page is displayed. Select the translator you want to use, then choose the source and destination languages through which you want to translate your text. Write the text to translate in the text view below then click Translate.
The translated text is shown in the yellow text view.

tip.para: If a default translator was chosen from settings, it's selected in the Translator drop down list.
The text to translate can be automatically retrieved from the clipboard, depending on your settings.
The translated text can be automatically copied in your clipboard, depending on your settings.

sect2.title: Translate a web page
sect2.para:
To translate text, choose
Translation Text or press
Ctrl B .

The Web Translation page is displayed. Select the translator you want to use, then choose the source and destination languages through which you want to translate the web page. Write the url to translate in the entry below then click Translate.
The Embedded Browser shows the translated web page. Alternatively, if you click the Link button below a browser instance is opened with the translated web page.

tip.para: If a default translator was chosen from settings, it's selected in the Translator drop down list.
If the clipboard contains a valid URL it's copied in the URL Entry, depending on your settings.
The URL of the translated web page can be automatically copied in your clipboard, depending on your settings.

sect2.title: Suggestions for translating a phrase
sect2.para:
To request translation suggestions, choose
Translation Suggestions or press
Ctrl S .

The Translation Suggestions page is displayed. Select the translator you want to use, then choose the source and destination languages through which you want to translate the web page. Write the phrase to translate in the entry below then click Translate.
The yellow Tree View shows all the possible translation solutions you might want to adopt. Right click on a row to open the Popup Menu.

tip.para: If a default translator was chosen from settings, it's selected in the Translator drop down list.
The text to translate can be automatically retrieved from the clipboard, depending on your settings.

sect2.title: Closing a Translation
sect2.para:
To close a translation page, choose
Translation Close This Translation or click the Close Button in the tab above.

To quit &app; and close all of the tabs that you opened in the current session, choose
Translation Quit or press
Ctrl Q .

sect1.title: Preferences
sect1.para:
To configure &app;, choose
Edit Preferences or press
Ctrl P . The Preferences dialog contains the following options:

listitem.para: If this option is set &app; obtains the data to be translated from the clipboard when a new translation page opens.
If this option is set &app; saves the translated data in the clipboard when the translation is done.
Use this drop-down list box to specify the default translator that &app; uses when translating data.
Click on the blue Accel Box to specify the key binding to use when translating the text or url contained in the clipboard.
